text: snake-oil
oh hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd it is
really hot today it is really humid
today but we still need to do it as we
still need to do an album review and
we're going to do one of the new snake
oil LP snake oil and this is actually
the first time I'm reviewing a band from
my own backyard of Connecticut snake oil
is a collective of ten musicians from
what I've been told hailing from my
state and New York and Massachusetts and
even though there are a lot of cooks in
on this broth the band still comes
together with a pretty cohesive
instrumental psych rock sound for the
self-titled debut it's nine tracks 29
minutes but most of the songs here do
last long enough to leave an impression
on me who posted that picture of me with
hair was it you are you sure well
someone posted it it's just I used to
have hair so what is now I just shaved
my head well like I said between the
nine tracks on this LP snake oil comes
up with a direction it's not the most
original direction in the world but
still cohesive now for me easily the
best thing this album has going for it
the production guitar face organ drums
various sound effects and studio tricks
all of them come through clear as a bell
and when all the sounds layer over each
other on some of these tracks into this
sweet sonic casserole of psychedelia I
just want to shove it in my ears and try
to find a way to eat it that way that
guitar on the song I was a total pyro
the opener to this LP listening to that
for me is like wearing three sweaters in
a sauna just start purse parading
listening to it and that's some pretty
nice groove to it too and that's the
thing I like about this album a lot of
great grooves the track no fear all
animal is another great groove on the
cell
p I love the way that song moves and i
love the oriental esque guitar melody
bouncing over that track it's like
dropping a bunch of ice cubes into an
empty glass all at once there are a few
quieter moments on here which go over
all right like I'm song hungry Z which
has a tempo maintained by a drum machine
and while that sort of carries on and
keeps the song constant keeps it moving
the van just creates a soundscape of
guitar feedback and cymbal crashes but I
think my favorite softer moment here is
siedel in the salt flats one of the
tracks toward the end of this LP and
that song to me as a sense of place more
than any other track here listening to
that is kind of like wandering through
the desert into some kind of
kaleidoscopic horizon with swirling
clouds and multicolored buzzards and
tumbleweeds I love the beat it starts
off with and when that first guitar
comes in its whoa but i'm not completely
in love with this LP i do have my
reservations about it there are a lot of
points here where it doesn't rock and i
don't mean like there are softer moments
here i don't mean there are quieter
tracks i mean the latter songs at some
moments feel way too rigid in mechanical
constrained take the track can of love
and the captain for example the riff on
that track that drops it around the two
minute mark i kind of feel like at that
point a bomb should be going off but at
best it just kind of sounds like a
firecracker it's just the band is
latching on to this really constant
tempo and they're not really moving
together as a unit on some parts of this
album just sometimes where the drums are
going and where the rest of the
instrumentation is going seems like a
different place so some of the
instrumentals here do come off sounding
like sugar-coated psychedelics like they
would soundtrack a scene where a
character is doing drugs in an
after-school special or like I can see
them going over pretty well in an
elevator like a trippy elevator there
are a few spots here where snake oil
feels like they're letting go getting a
little noisier like on the last track or
go center but it's just not enough for
me I want to be overwhelmed damn you
still the sound the recording a lot of
the melodies the grooves are all pretty
good on this album and for the most part
the textures here really shoot for
something similar to dumbo gets mad or
even black moth super rainbow without
all the fuzz and weird vocals it's not
amazing me but it's a solid debut there
are links below this video on YouTube
and on the needle drop com or you can
hear cuts of this record this thing is
self released the band is selling the
vinyl and the digital on their website
let me know what you think of it do you
love it do you hate it why and what
should I be reviewing next Anthony
Fantana snake oil /
you
